question_text: How does virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) reduce hardware requirements on the client side?
answer_options: By allocating physical GPU cores to every client
By running all software and storage remotely
By transferring entire VMs to client disks
By bypassing the operating system entirely
correct_answer: By running all software and storage remotely
explanation: In VDI, the desktop environment is hosted on a server, so client devices only need minimal resources.
